prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would. Find the sum of $111_4+323_4+132_4$. Express your answer in base $4$.
solution: Since $1_4+3_4+2_4=12_4$, we carry over the $1$. Then we have $1_4+1_4+2_4+3_4=13_4$, so we carry over another $1$. For the leftmost column, we have $1_4+1_4+3_4+1_4=12_4$. In column format, this reads $$ \begin{array}{c@{}c@{\;}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} & & & _{1} &_{1}&\\ & & & 1& 1 & 1_4\\ & & & 3 & 2 & 3_4\\& & + & 1 & 3 & 2_4\\ \cline{2-6} & & 1 & 2 & 3& 2_4\\ \end{array} $$The sum is $\boxed{1232_4}$.
gpt_response:
To find the sum of these numbers, we can add them together just like we would with base $10$ numbers. 

Let's add the numbers vertically, starting from the rightmost column.

\[
\begin{array}{c@{}c@{\;}c@{}c@{}c@{}c}
& & & & 1 & 1 1 1 \\
& & & + & 3 & 2 3 3 \\
&  & & + & 1 & 3 2 \\
\cline{1-6}
& & 1 & 3 & 1 & 0 6
\end{array}
\]

So, $111_4+323_4+132_4$ equals $13106_4$ in base $4$.
